GameDBLocalizedString.Text: Visit Captain Holester with Admiral Muff
<color=SOTS_COLOR_MOVEMENT>Visit Captain Holester with Admiral Muff - Finished</color>
Rescue Holester's army
<color=SOTS_COLOR_MOVEMENT>Rescue Holester's army - Finished</color>
Visit Major Skaurov with Admiral Muff
<color=SOTS_COLOR_MOVEMENT>Visit Major Skaurov with Admiral Muff - Finished</color>
Conquer the Sovereign Fleet bases
<color=SOTS_COLOR_MOVEMENT>Conquer the Sovereign Fleet bases - Finished</color>
Enter the Central Territories
<color=SOTS_COLOR_MOVEMENT>Enter the Central Territories - Finished</color>
Conquer the Central Teritorries
Nemek, the only agricultural ship in the fleet. I remember the rebellion. Nearly all loyalists died of hunger back then. Heh! I almost cooked my shoes.

We played the "He who can destroy a thing has true control over it" card, but we were only willing to go so far.\nNo one thought the Supreme Leader would order the bombardement of the fleet's only source of food.\nNobody understood what he was capable of risking to stay in power.
We know now. By the way, it still feels so weird calling you 'Admiral'. I can't believe you suffered taking orders from me, a mere General of Production. I'm just a walking joke in comparison.
How remarkably self-aware of you! You definitely were, when we first met. But look at you now, my friend. A true battle-hardened revolutionary general.
'Friend'? Don't be a fool, you are only a tool.
Speaking of revolution, it might be better if you meet your friends in person. After all, I will be a stranger to them.
True. I will start with Captain Holester. He got lucky and with a fresh new false identity became a colony warden.
Skaurov, our mole in the Supreme Leader's camp, got sniffed out. But miraculously, he ended up in the Penal Legion instead of facing a firing squad.
Another Fossorian? You furry Judases broke the truce by torturing Kali Chapek, a captain of the Sovereign Fleet.
What? We did not do anything to him! The bastard was free and completely unharmed when I last saw him.
Lies won't save you when the Sovereign Fleet retaliates.
My favorite Fossorian Warlords! I am here to protect my investment, so I brought a friend to assist you. He knows how to run a Sovereign Fleet base and is as loyal as a mercenary can be.
Admiral Muff! There could only be one reason why you'd show up.
Yes, Captain, I need your skills once more. The Supreme Leader has a debt and I am preparing a bloody payback!
I lost my rank the day my ship imploded under the barrage. I am just an anonymous warden of a small mining colony now.
And how does an ordinary life suit you?
I should have gone down with my ship. But joining you now would be suicide. Besides, I have a problem of my own.
I got ambushed when I was inspecting an outpost to the south. I managed to flee but those Sovereign Fleet pirates besieged my warriors. Break the siege and we will talk again.
Greetings old friend. What brings you here?
Do I know you?
It would be better if you talked to Admiral Muff himself.
Admiral Muff is here? Bring him to me I wish to speak with him!
We owe you our lives, warlord. We will join you to pay this debt.
Impressive, maybe we have a chance at whatever stupid thing you are planning to do.
Days before the rebellion was crushed he faked his own death and was already searching for a way back to the loyalists. Clever, you should do the same Furret.
A commander has joined you!
Admiral Muff! On a warpath to overthrow the Supreme Leader, am I right?
Good guess, Major.
Wait, it was a joke! You cannot be serious. We got crushed last time! CRUSHED! Remember!?
Nobody remembers better than me! The Supreme Leader destroyed my ships, executed my friends, and crushed my dreams. They were also your friends and your dreams, Skaurov!
Sometimes I almost manage to forget. I would join you at once, admiral, if it wasn't for this one issue.
The high command sent me to place a radio beacon between the Sovereign Fleet bases to the south. But those pirates pinned us down the moment we arrived.
I cannot help you while the Sovereign Fleet pirates are threatening our back.
I know this RADIO BEACON tactic all too well. Don't worry about your back, I will deal with the pirates.
I know this RADIO BEACON tactic all too well. Don't worry about your back, I have already dealt with the pirates.
And the RADIO BEACON. Would you mind if I take it? It might prove useful later.
What are my orders?

They were only pups when Skaurov stepped between his little brother and an angry tunnel worm. The scarred face reminds the Supreme Leader that he froze shaking in the puddle of his own piss while his brother fought the monster. Oh, how he hates him! Can you hate so much Furret? You should learn that!
The old rebels have assembled! But beware! We will be attacked the moment we try to enter the central territories. What is the plan?
You know what? I think I will borrow a page from your book, Furret. Take everyone and charge!
YEAH! That's the Fossorian way!
Splendid, I managed to arrive just in time to warn the local garrison about you! Sergant Moltair! Bring me his head! Now, I must go and inform the Supreme Leader!
Err, commissar? Wouldn't you and your troops rather stay ... to supervise our victory? The rebel army is bigger than we anticipated.
DO AS I COMMAND! A firing squad is the only alternative I offer.
As you command, commissar!
What a coward!
INCOMPETENT IMBECILES! I left for only a moment and everything turned to ash! But I am cut from a different mold. You will see.
You may have enough warriors to usurp a province, but against the might of the Supreme Leader's army, you have no chance! Stay, run, or invade, it matters not. You are on borrowed time!
Tell him that Admiral Muff sends his regards! He will know.
I promised that I would repay you for my time in the Penal Legion. Consider this the first check!
This is for our executed brothers and for Nemek! Down with the tyranny of the Supreme Leader!
I don't think so. My employers are quite the legendary raiders. And I believe those guys will kick your boss's ass.
This valley leads to the center of Fossorian territory. Only a fool would advance without the armies of other warlords on our side!
Another day, another filthy halfbreed!

The path to the heart of Fossorian territory is clear. Sure, the rebels lack the numbers, but assembling the Supreme Leader's armies, most of which are occupied by skirmishes in the border regions, will take a long time.\nOne quick, precise strike is all it takes. But if our 'heroes' miss, there will be no second chance. Luckily, they have a few aces up their sleeves.\nAnd if everything goes south? There's the RADIO BEACON acquired by Admiral Muff. By now you already know what it really is and as one wise Fossorian once said, "A nuclear weapon is always the best starting point for every successful negotiation!".
